title.narrative: Construction of Somalia Ministry of Health Offices

description.narrative: Construct a new Ministry of Health headquarters to provide a quality working environment in order to increase the capacity of the Ministry to support the health needs of Somali.

FN organisationen UNOPS (United Nations Office for Project Services) har ansökt om finansiellt stöd från Sverige för att bygga och rekonstruera hälsoministeriets byggnad i Mogadishu, Somalia. Insatsen har som huvudsyfte att stödja den somaliska regeringen och dess mål att leverera och nå ut med hälso-och-sjukvårds tjänster för sin befolkning. Insatsen är ett samarbete mellan FN och den federala regeringen i Somalia och kommer att genomföras under perioden 1 Jan 2015 till 30 Dec 2017. Den totala budgeten för insatsen beräknas att uppgå till ca 14.8 miljoner svenska kronor.

UNOPS has applied to Sida for funding of 14.8 Million SEK to carry out the project "Support to Construction of Ministry of Health (MOH) offices in Mogadishu, Somali” during the period 2015-01-01 to 2017-12-30.
The intervention aims at constructing a new Ministry of Health headquarter building to provide a quality working environment and thus increase the capacity of the ministry to support the health needs of Somalia. Specifically, the intervention will: 1) Demolish the existing building and construct a new office block for the ministry; 2) Construct a new boundary wall to enclose the new compound together with other external works; 3) Capacity build the local contractors through technical training; 4) Undertake an assessment of the operation and maintenance requirements for the new facility and prepare a proposal for future funding, inclusive of an outline operation and maintenance plan.
UNOPS will implement the intervention in collaboration with the Somali Federal Government through the Ministries of Health, Planning and Public Works. The intervention’s total budget is estimated at 14.8 million SEK and Sweden will fully support the budget. The government will provide land for the construction.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project was achieved. There is a new MoH headquarters building that has been occupied by the ministry officials and is providing them with quality working conditions. UNOPS designed, supervised and managed the construction of a new two storey building for the MoH in Mogadishu. This also included the design, procurement and installation of renewable energy system (solar) to power the building. The capacity of the government in procurement and engagement of contractors was enhanced. Further, the project built the capacity of two government engineers who were engaged in the construction process. Social and gender considerations were considered including ensuring the building is equipped with separate washrooms for women and men and also addressing the special needs of the physically challenged.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
